fig.title: : Loss of THEM6 impairs PCa tumour growth following ADT.
fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: A, Volcano plot of the differentially modulated proteins in 22rv1 (CRPC) versus CWR22res (HN) tumours. Red and blue dots represent the proteins that are significantly up- and down-regulated, respectively (p-value < 0.05, FC = 1.5). Data information: Data reproducibility: n = 3 tumours per group.

B, Western blot analysis of THEM6 expression in CRPC (22rv1 and LNCaP AI) and HN (CWR22res and LNCaP) prostate orthografts. VCL was used as a sample loading control. Data information: Data reproducibility: : n = 1 gel loaded with three prostate orthografts per condition.

C, IHC staining of THEM6 expression in CWR22res and 22rv1 orthografts. Scale bar represents 100 µm. Data information: Data reproducibility: representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.

D, Western blot analysis of THEM6 expression in CTL and THEM6 KO CRPC cells. HSC70 was used as a sample loading control. Data information: Data reproducibility: : representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.

E, Proliferation of CTL and THEM6 KO CRPC cells after 72 hours. Data are expressed as a percentage of CTL cells. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Panel Statistical analysis: 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent biological experiments.

F, Cell stiffness (Young's modulus) of CTL and THEM6 KO CRPC cells measured by atomic force microscopy. Data information: : Centre line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom lines correspond to maximal and minimal values. Statistical analysis: 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: (up): n = 46 (CTL); 47 (KO1); 49 (KO2) cells measured. (down): n = 31 (CTL); 43 (KO1); 50 (KO2) cells measured.

G, Tumour volume (measured by ultrasound) of CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1-derived orthografts developed in surgically castrated mice. H, Tumour volume of CTL and THEM6 KO LNCaP AI-derived xenografts developed in surgically castrated mice. I, Tumour volume (measured by ultrasound) of CTL and THEM6 KO CWR22res-derived orthografts. Orchidectomy was performed 3-weeks after cell implantation. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: G, H: two-tailed Mann-Whitney U test. I: Kruskal-Wallis test. Data reproducibility: G, I: n = 5 mice per group. Panel H: n = 7 mice per group.

fig.title: : Loss of THEM6 alters lipid homeostasis.
fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: A, Heatmap illustrating the steady-state levels of significantly regulated lipids in THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells when compared to CTL (p ≤ 0.05, FC = 1.3). Values are expressed as log2(FC). Data information: Data reproducibility: : n = 3 independent biological experiments. EV: Empty Vector; DAG: diacylglycerol; TG: triglyceride; PC: phosphatidylcholine; PE: phosphatidylethanolamine; PI: phosphatidylinositol; LysoPC: lysophosphatidylcholine; LysoPE: lysophosphatidylethanolamine; Cer: Ceramide; SM: sphingomyelin; CE: Cholesteryl ester.

B-C, Changes in lipid content (total amount) observed in THEM6 KO CRPC cells when compared to CTL. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis : *p-value < 0.05 using a 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent biological experiments. DAG: diacylglycerol; TG: triglyceride; PC: phosphatidylcholine; PE: phosphatidylethanolamine; PI: phosphatidylinositol; LysoPC: lysophosphatidylcholine; LysoPE: lysophosphatidylethanolamine; Cer: Ceramide; SM: sphingomyelin; CE: Cholesteryl ester.

D, Heatmap illustrating the steady-state levels of significantly regulated lipids in THEM6 OE CWR22res cells when compared to EV (p ≤ 0.05, FC = 1.2). Values are expressed as log2(FC). Data information: Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent biological experiments. EV: Empty Vector; DAG: diacylglycerol; TG: triglyceride; PC: phosphatidylcholine; PE: phosphatidylethanolamine; PI: phosphatidylinositol; LysoPC: lysophosphatidylcholine; LysoPE: lysophosphatidylethanolamine; Cer: Ceramide; SM: sphingomyelin; CE: Cholesteryl ester.

E, Changes in lipid content (total amount) observed in THEM6 OE CWR22res cells when compared to EV. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: : *p-value < 0.05 using a two-tailed Student's t-test. Data reproducibility: : n = 3 independent biological experiments. EV: Empty Vector; DAG: diacylglycerol; TG: triglyceride; PC: phosphatidylcholine; PE: phosphatidylethanolamine; PI: phosphatidylinositol; LysoPC: lysophosphatidylcholine; LysoPE: lysophosphatidylethanolamine; Cer: Ceramide; SM: sphingomyelin; CE: Cholesteryl ester.
F, Average Raman spectra of CWR22res CTL and THEM6 KO orthografts. Data information: Data reproducibility: : n = 4 mice per group.

G-H, Quantification of tumour lipid (2845 cm-1-peak) and cholesterol (2880 cm-1-peak) content obtained from F. Data information: Centre line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom lines correspond to upper and lower quartiles. Statistical analysis Kruskal-Wallis test. Data reproducibility: : n = 6581 (CTL); 12047 (KO1); 6493 (KO2) peak intensities that were extracted from 4 mice per group.

fig.title: : THEM6 interacts with multiple ER membrane components involved in protein transport.
fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: A, Venn diagram highlighting commonly modulated proteins (p-value ≤ 0.05, FC = 1.3) in THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells (2 clones) when compared to CTL. Up-regulated proteins are on top; Down-regulated proteins are into brackets.
B, Enriched cellular components commonly down-regulated in THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells (2 clones) when compared to CTL. Data information: Enrichment analysis were performed using the STRING database

C, Representative electron microscopy (EM) pictures of CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells taken at low (left) and high (right) magnification. Red arrows point towards abnormal ER structure. Scale bar represents 500 nm.

D, Quantification of ER membrane length, plasma membrane length and ER/plasma membrane ratio using the EM pictures from C. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: Unpaired t-test. Data reproducibility: n = 20 cells/condition.

E, Immunofluorescence showing co-localisation of THEM6 and the ER marker calreticulin in 22rv1 cells. Scale bar represents 20 µm. Data information: Data reproducibility: representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.
F, Prediction of transmembrane domain in the sequence of the THEM6 protein. Topology prediction was performed using the TMHMM server

G, Western blot analysis of THEM6 expression in cytoplasmic (cyto.), membrane/organelle (memb.) and nuclear fractions (nucl.) of 22rv1 cells. HSC70 and SP1 were used as cytoplasmic and nuclear-enriched markers, respectively. Data information: Data reproducibility: representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.
H, Enriched cellular components in THEM6-interacting proteins following THEM6 pulldown in T6 OE HEK293 cells. Data information: Enrichment analysis were performed using the STRING database

I, Western blot analysis of THEM6, AMFR, SEC61b and XPO1 expression in CRPC cells following THEM6 immunoprecipitation in CRPC cells. Data information: Data reproducibility: representative image from 2 independent biological experiments.
J, Western blot analysis of CALX and CALR expression in PCa cells following THEM6 silencing. Data information: Data reproducibility: representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.

fig.title: : Loss of THEM6 affects de novo sterol and fatty acid synthesis.
fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: A, Proteomic analysis highlighting proteins associated with sterol biosynthetic pathway and significantly down-regulated in THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells when compared to CTL (p-value ≤ 0.05, FC = 1.3 Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent biological experiments.

B, RT-qPCR analysis of MVD, FDPS and DHCR7 expression in CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells. CASC3 was used as a normalising control. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: : *p-value < 0.05 using 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: : n = 3 independent biological experiments.
C, Gene set enrichment plots analysed from THEM6 KO LNCaP AI cells using the GOBP "Sterol homeostasis" gene set.

D, Labelled desmosterol fraction derived from 13C-glucose and 13C-glutamine in CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells after 72 hours of incubation. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: : *p-value < 0.05 using 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent wells from the same cell culture.

E, Relative isotopologue distribution of desmosterol in CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells after 72 hours of incubation. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: : *p-value < 0.05 using 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent wells from the same cell culture.

F, Labelled cholesterol fraction derived from 13C-glucose and 13C-glutamine in CTL and THEM6 KO CWR22res cells after 72 hours of incubation. G, Labelled cholesterol fraction derived from 13C-glucose and 13C-glutamine in CTL and THEM6 KO MCF-7 cells after 72 hours of incubation. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: , F, : *p-value < 0.05 using 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. G: *p-value < 0.05 using a two-tailed Student t-test. Data reproducibility: : n = 3 independent wells from the same cell culture.
H, Pearson's correlation analysis of SQLE, LSS, DHCR7 and DHCR24 with THEM6 using the PRAD TCGA dataset. Results were obtained using the GEPIA website

I, Differential expression of ACACA in high and low THEM6 tumours according to the PRAD TCGA dataset. Data information: Centre line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom of box correspond to 90th and 10th percentile, respectively. Whiskers extend to adjacent values (minimum and maximum data points not considered outliers). Statistical analysis: two-tailed Mann-Whitney U test. Data reproducibility: : n = 225 tumours for THEM6 low and n = 121 tumours for THEM6 high.

J, Labelled palmitic, oleic and stearic acid fractions derived from 13C-glucose and 13C-glutamine in CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells after 72 hours of incubation. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: : *p-value < 0.05 using 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent wells from the same cell culture.

K, Relative isotopologue distribution of palmitic acid in CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells after 72 hours of incubation. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: : *p-value < 0.05 using 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent wells from the same cell culture.

fig.title: : THEM6-mediated lipid remodelling is required for UPR activation.
fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: A, Enriched biological processes commonly down-regulated in THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells (2 clones) when compared to CTL.

B, Proteomic analysis highlighting proteins associated with the ER stress response significantly down-regulated in THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells when compared to CTL (p-value ≤ 0.05, FC = 1.3). Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent biological experiments.

C, Western blot analysis of BIP, XBP1s, ATF4, CHOP and THEM6 expression in CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells. Data information: HSC70 was used as a sample loading control. Data reproducibility: representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.

D, Proliferation of CTL and THEM6 KO CRPC cells treated with tunicamycin (2.5 µg/ml) for 72 hours. Cell count is normalised to initial number of cells at T0. Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Statistical analysis: 1-way ANOVA with a Dunnett's multiple comparisons test. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent biological experiments.

E, Proteomic analysis highlighting ATF4 targets significantly down-regulated in THEM6 KO LNCaP AI cells when compared to CTL (p-value ≤ 0.05, FC = 1.3). Data information: Data are presented as mean values +/- SD. Data reproducibility: n = 3 independent biological experiments.

F, Western blot analysis of ATF4 and THEM6 expression in CTL and THEM6 KO LNCaP AI cells. Data information: HSC70 was used as a sample loading control. Data reproducibility: representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.

G, Western blot analysis of ATF4, CHOP and THEM6 expression in PCa cells following THEM6 silencing. Data information: HSC70 was used as a sample loading control. Data reproducibility: representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.

H, Differential expression of EIF4G1 and ASNS in high and low THEM6 tumours according to the PRAD TCGA dataset. Data information: Centre line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom of box correspond to 90th and 10th percentile, respectively. Whiskers extend to adjacent values (minimum and maximum data points not considered outliers). Statistical analysis: two-tailed Mann-Whitney U test. Data reproducibility: : n = 225 tumours for THEM6 low and n = 121 tumours for THEM6 high.

I, Western blot analysis of ATF4 and CHOP expression in CTL and THEM6 KO 22rv1 cells treated with palmitic acid (200 µM) for 48 hours. Data information: HSC70 was used as a sample loading control. Data reproducibility: : representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.

J, Western blot analysis of ATF4 and CHOP expression in CTL and THEM6 KO LNCaP AI cells treated with palmitic acid (200 µM) or hexadecylglycerol (50 µM) for 48 hours. Data information: HSC70 was used as a sample loading control. Data reproducibility: representative image from 3 independent biological experiments.

fig.title: : THEM6 is a clinically relevant target in CRPC.
fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: A, Gene expression analysis of THEM6/c8orf55 in normal and tumoural prostate tissues according to the PRAD TCGA dataset (n=489). Data information: Center line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom of box correspond to 75th and 25th percentile, respectively. Whiskers extend to adjacent values (minimum and maximum data points not considered outliers). Statistical analysis: pairwise ANOVA. Data reproducibility: n = 489 tumours.

B, Gene expression analysis of THEM6/c8orf55 in benign, localised and metastatic tumoural prostate tissues according to the GSE35988 dataset (n=122). Data information: Center line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom of box correspond to 75th and 25th percentile, respectively. Whiskers extend to adjacent values (minimum and maximum data points not considered outliers). Statistical analysis: pairwise ANOVA. Data reproducibility: n = 122 tumours.

C, Kaplan-Meier progression-free survival analysis of PCa patients stratified according high and low THEM6 expression using the PRAD TCGA dataset. D, Kaplan-Meier recurrence-free survival analysis of PCa patients stratified according to median THEM6 expression using the GSE21034 dataset (n = 179). Data information: Statistical analysis: logrank test. Data reproducibility: C: n = 489 tumours. D: n = 179.

E, IHC staining of THEM6 expression in treatment naïve, NHT-treated, CRPC and NEPC tumours. Scale bar represents 100 µm. Data information: Data reproducibility: : n = 132; 90; 66; 137; 44; 30 tumours for Untreated; NHT 1-3; NHT4-6; NHT>7; CRPC; NEPC respectively.

F, Quantification of THEM6 staining in PCa tissue samples. Data information: Centre line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom lines correspond to upper and lower quartiles. Data reproducibility: n = 132; 90; 66; 137; 44; 30 tumours for Untreated; NHT 1-3; NHT4-6; NHT>7; CRPC; NEPC respectively.

G-H, Quantification of THEM6 expression in PCa tissue samples according to Gleason score (G) and metastatic status (H) in the patients analysed in F. Data information: Centre line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom of box correspond to 90th and 10th percentile, respectively. Whiskers extend to adjacent values (minimum and maximum data points not considered outliers). Statistical analysis: two-tailed Mann-Whitney U test. Data reproducibility: G: n = 99 tumours for Gleason score ≤ 7 and n = 63 tumours for Gleason score > 7. Panel H: n = 151 tumours for non-metastatic patients and n = 76 tumours for metastatic patients.

I-J, Kaplan-Meier recurrence-free (I) and overall (J) survival analysis of PCa patients stratified according to median THEM6 expression. Data information: Statistical analysis: logrank test. Data reproducibility: n = 35 tumours for THEM6 low and n = 34 tumours for THEM6 high.

K, Quantification of THEM6 expression in PCa tissue samples according to Ki67 expression in the patients analysed in F. L, Quantification of THEM6 expression in PCa tissue samples according to Ki67 expression in the patients analysed in I-J. Data information: Centre line corresponds to median of data, top and bottom of box correspond to 90th and 10th percentile, respectively. Whiskers extend to adjacent values (minimum and maximum data points not considered outliers). Statistical analysis: two-tailed Mann-Whitney U test. Data reproducibility: K: n = 269 tumours for Ki67 low and n = 270 tumours for Ki67 high. L: n = 35 tumours for Ki67 low and n = 29 tumours for Ki67 high.

M, Volcano plot of the differentially modulated genes in PCa patients from the PRAD TCGA stratified according to THEM6 expression. Red dots represent the UPR-related genes extracted from the UPR-gene signature Data information: Data reproducibility: n = 489 tumours.
N, Gene set enrichment plot analysed from PCa patients of the PRAD TCGA dataset using the UPR gene signature
